definition: shameless
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
color/face/countenance
surname Yan
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
shame/disgrace

sentences.english: And we had the cheek to call the Taliban vandals.
sentences.chinese: 而我們還曾厚顏無恥地稱塔利班爲野蠻人。

sentences.english: It is the most impudent piece of pretension I ever heard of in my life.
sentences.chinese: 這是我一生中從沒聽說過的最厚顏無恥的一項要求了。

sentences.english: To tell a barefaced lie to your friends will create bad relationships.
sentences.chinese: 告訴朋友厚顏無恥的謊言，將會造成不良的關係。

sentences.english: And the site's cheeky bravado rubs salt in the wounds.
sentences.chinese: 並且網站厚顏無恥並自信滿滿地往它們的傷口上撒鹽。

sentences.english: It illustrated the thuggeryand brazenness of the state machine.
sentences.chinese: 這很好地詮釋了這個國家機器的暗箱操作和厚顏無恥。

sentences.english: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentences.chinese: 那人十足的厚顏無恥讓人們喫驚得無話可說。

sentences.english: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentences.chinese: 厚顏無恥由於愚昧無知。

sentences.english: What knocks me is his impudence.
sentences.chinese: 他的厚顏無恥使我感到喫驚。

sentences.english: We want Japan to know him to be bold-faced, is impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我們要日本知道他是厚顏無恥的，是不可能的。
我對你的厚顏無恥感到驚奇。

sentences.english: She said, you are an illegitimate daughter, also have no shame to find people to support you.
sentences.chinese: 她說，你一個私生女，還厚顏無恥地來找人家養你。

sentences.english: That’s the audacity of hope at full stretch.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他們竭盡全力所希望達到的厚顏無恥之境界。

sentences.english: I was annoyed at his impudence.
She brazened through the accusation from the witness stand.
sentences.chinese: 她厚顏無恥地抵賴證人對她的指控。

sentences.english: Japanese is the nationality with great effrontery.
sentences.chinese: 日本是一個非常厚顏無恥的民族。

definition: reckless/extremely daring
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
lit. small abacus/fig. selfish calculations/bean-counting
ability/skill
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
annoying/disgusting
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
